thread.title: Toronto Blue Jays vs. Texas Rangers ALDS Game 5 live score: Online stream, TV schedule
thread.title_full: Toronto Blue Jays vs. Texas Rangers ALDS Game 5 live score: Online stream, TV schedule

author: Nick O'Malley | nomalley@masslive.com
title: Toronto Blue Jays vs. Texas Rangers ALDS Game 5 live score: Online stream, TV schedule
text:
Comments 
The Texas Rangers and Toronto Blue meet in a winner-take-all ALDS Game 5 on Wednesday. Here's all the game info you need, along with listings for the TV broadcast and live stream services. You can also keep up with live scoring updates in the box score above. Game info 
Start Time : 4:00 p.m. EST Location : Rogers Centre TV Broadcast 
Network : Fox Sports 1 Channel : Click here to check out Fox Sports 1's channel finder to find your local channel. Live Stream 
With the MLB postseason moving to national broadcasts, it's easier to get ahead of an online broadcast. Even the official MLB option is more reasonable. 
Fox Sports 1 has a solid streaming service for desktop and mobile. It's free for cable subscribers, which may make things a little tricky for folks who cut the cord. 
MLB.tv Postseason Package - A package from the league that lets you catch postseason games streaming on your computer and other devices. May not include all ALCS/NLCS games. 
Fox Sports Go (or Fox Sports Go mobile app ) - Fox carries a pretty good streaming service for national games -- free for cable subscribers. 
--- 
The Blue Jays made the curious decision of having ace David Price pitch in relief in a Game 4 situation in which Toronto was already up six runs late. It was a weird move then, and will continue to be discussed as they head into Game 5 without him starting the game. In his stead, the Blue Jays will send youngster Marcus Stroman to make the start. Stroman was effective in his first career playoff outing, going seven innings while giving up three earned runs. 
Meanwhile, the Rangers still have the services of trade acquisition Cole Hamels at their disposal. We won't get the traded ace vs. traded ace scenario some may have dreamed of for Game 5, and that might just work in Texas' favor.
